title: ICE: inherent_associated_types: `Unexpected parameter Type(S<'a>) when substituting in region 'a (index=0)`  with -Zdump-mir=all

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
### Code `rustc -Zdump-mir=all late-bound-regions.rs` ```Rust #![feature(inherent_associated_types)] type Function = for<'a> fn(&'a i32) -> S<'a>::P; struct S<'a>(&'a ()); impl<'a> S<'a> { type P = &'a i32; } fn ret_ref_local<'e>() -> &'e i32 { let f: Function = |x| x; let local = 0; f(&local) } fn main() {} ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.71.0-nightly (2f2c438dc 2023-05-08) binary: rustc commit-hash: 2f2c438dce75d8cc532c3baa849eeddc0901802c commit-date: 2023-05-08 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.71.0-nightly LLVM version: 16.0.2 ``` ### Error output ``` ```
Backtrace
